comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content: Francis Rothery Barthorp born circa 1899 Sproughton, Suffolk. Appears in the UK Naval Medal Roll and was eligible for the British War Medal and Victory Medal. Gazetted 17 Nov 1918 R.N.V.R. Temp. Mid. to be Sub-Lieut.— Francis R. Barthorp. www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/31025/pages/13739/page.pdf On 9 Apr 1920 he was a passenger aboard the "Norman" bound for Cape Town. he gave his age as 21. Profession shown as BSAP Rec (British South African Police recruit).

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content:
In 1901 FR Barthorp was at Blairlogie Castle, Logie, Stirlingshire, Scotland aged 1 and described as the cousin of Mary ES Hare aged 47. His sister was also there - Mollie H C Barthorp, aged 5. [Mollie Helen C Barthorp born 27 Apr 1895, died in Weymouth in 1990].

In 1911 he was a Student at St Lawrence College, Hollicondane, Ramsgate.

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content: London Gazette of 1916 refers to a Henry Arthur Barthorp who was resident at the Grove, Sproughton in the county of Suffolk Esquire in December 1899. www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/27175/pages/1916/page.pdf 1911 census shows Henry Arthur Barthorp aged 46 and his wife Cecily Jean aged 43 living at 52 Coleherne Court, Kensington. They had been married for 16 years and had 2 children (not resident with them on census night). Mr Barthorp was born at Hollesley, Suffolk and his wife was originally from Nova Scotia. Henry Barthorp died in 1949 and probate was granted to Mollie Helen Cicely Barthorp, Spinster. Cecily Jean had died a decade earlier.

comment.author: 60271754@N03
comment._content: This is my great aunt's first husband! He married Marjorie Heathcote Ledgard Thompson in the late 1930s, presumably in Rhodesia as I have been unable to find a marriage certificate.They had one son in 1941 Christopher John Barthorp. The marriage ended at the end of WW2 and my aunt and her son returned to England. I dont know what happens to Francis after this.
